concise_definition: v. 担任裁判, 主持仪式, 执行公务

definitions.explanation_en: To act as an official in charge of enforcing the rules and managing the conduct of a formal event, especially a sports match or ceremony.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指作为负责人执行规则、管理正式活动（尤其是体育比赛或仪式）的进行。
definitions.example_en: She was officiating the championship game as the head referee.
definitions.example_cn: 她担任这场冠军赛的主裁判。

definitions.explanation_en: To perform the duties of a religious or civil official in conducting a formal ceremony, such as a wedding or funeral.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指作为宗教或民政官员主持正式仪式，如婚礼或葬礼。
definitions.example_en: The mayor officiated the couple's wedding ceremony at City Hall.
definitions.example_cn: 市长在市政厅主持了这对新人的婚礼。

definitions.explanation_en: To carry out an official function or duty, often in a position of authority or public responsibility.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在具有权威或公共责任的职位上履行官方职能或职责。
definitions.example_en: He was officiating as the interim director while the new appointee was being vetted.
definitions.example_cn: 在新任命者接受审查期间，他暂代主任一职。

comparison.analysis: “Refereeing” (担任裁判) 是 “officiating” 在体育语境中的具体化，专指在竞技比赛中执行规则。而 “officiating” 范围更广，可涵盖婚礼、典礼、行政事务等非体育场景。
“Presiding” (主持) 强调在会议、法庭或仪式中担任主席或主导者，侧重于引导流程和维持秩序，但不一定涉及规则执行。而 “officiating” 更强调依据正式职责或权威执行程序，常带有法律或制度性权威。
“Administering” (管理/执行) 通常指对系统、法律、药物或资源的管理与分配，侧重于操作性与组织性。而 “officiating” 更强调在公开仪式或活动中以官方身份履行象征性或程序性职责，具有更强的仪式感和公共可见性。
